justification: “Because ‘valid consent’ is a technical term… we used three measures to assess judgments of valid consent… The three consent items created a reliable scale… averaged together to create a composite measure of consent.”

“We also used five new ‘ownership transfer’ measures… The five measures of ownership transfer showed very high scale reliability (α =.89), so a composite measure of ownership transfer was created by averaging together all five variables.”

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Morality: Under these circumstances, it was morally wrong…’ (reverse-scored)
justification: “Moral judgments of the consented-to action were measured as follows: Morality: Under these circumstances, it was morally wrong for Sam to proceed with selling the bracelet. (reverse-scored).”

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Right Choice: … was probably the right choice…’
justification: “We also measured participants’ judgments of the extent to which the agent was making the right choice by saying ‘yes’: Right Choice: Having surgery was probably the right choice for Marvin.”

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Freedom: Y freely chose to z’
justification: The measures list includes “Freedom: Y freely chose to z,” used after each vignette to gauge perceived freedom.

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Rational capacity: Y has the ability to make rational decisions’
justification: Under manipulation checks, participants rated “Rational capacity: Marvin has the ability to make rational decisions.”

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Authentic capacity: Y has the ability to be true to himself when making decisions’
justification: Manipulation checks included “Authentic capacity: Marvin has the ability to be true to himself when making decisions.”

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Capacity for autonomy: Y has the ability to shape his own life freely according to his own values…’
justification: Study 2 added the item “Capacity for autonomy: Marvin has the ability to shape his own life freely according to his own values and what is right for him.”

measured_by: Single Likert item ‘Decided autonomously: The way Y made this particular decision expressed an ability to shape his life freely…’
justification: Study 2 also asked participants to rate “Decided autonomously: The way Marvin made this particular decision expressed an ability to shape his life freely according to his own values and what is right for him.”
